intro: Alsodeiopsis poggei, commonly known as the Pogge's alsodeiopsis, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has a low-growing habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
